summary: With nearly seven years of marketing and communications expertise, I specialize in impact reporting, brand visibility, and strategic campaigns. I've worked with several international organizations like the ZDHC Foundation, United Nations, and Tertium (Urgent Foundation), where I have been able to craft my skills in reporting, project planning, content creation, event management, and communication strategies. Additionally, I have experience in production, contributing to shows like WWF's Ocean Witness and Comedy Central's Stand-Up Asia. I hold a Master's degree in Political Science from Leiden University and a Bachelor of Communication from Monash University. Explore my portfolio at: https://bit.ly/3HBMPBD.

projects.title: DOCUMENTARY: 'iinaa bialmanzil - انا بالمنزل (I AM HOME)
projects.description: A documentary that explores complex questions about home, identity, belonging and citizenship through the eyes of transnational youth residing in the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) region. The documentary challenges the GCC region’s Kafala System as it exists today by exploring the ‘temporary’ status of transnational youth born or residing in the region from infancy. Presently, such transnational youth in the GCC region risk family separation and deportation due to their legal status of ‘temporary residents’, a status that averages a duration of 20 years without a comprehensible path to naturalization or permanent residency.

projects.title: ZDHC's Impact Day 2022 and Impact Report 2021
ONLINE EXHIBITION: Peace & Dreams: A Child Perspective
projects.description:
In an effort to raise awareness about landmine contamination and casualties, the Mine Mark Foundation organised an online exhibition showcasing drawings by children living in landmine contaminated areas and contrasted them with drawings done by children raised in peaceful, unaffected countries. 

The exhibition was divided into four sections (Ukraine, Azerbaijan, Bosnia and Herzegovina, and Non-Conflict Countries) to contrast not just peace and conflict but also the many stages of conflict itself.

publications.name: Mobile Youth and Belonging in the Gulf: A Study of Dubai

profile_positions.title: Brand, Marketing And Public Relations Manager

profile_positions.description:

- Managed freelancers, and externals (including their contracts, and scope of work).
- Created and established new project management processes and budget plans across the department.
- Created and implemented the use of media and communication guidelines and toolkits.
- Managed and executed key releases:

     * Wrote and managed press releases
- Served as the brand manager for the entire organisation, to protect its identity and credibility, including regulating the use of its logos and certificates, creating logos and certificates, maintaining the upkeep of all ZDHC websites, and updating the homepage of the Roadmap to Zero website.
- Conducted crisis communication
- Managed newsletters for internal and external stakeholders.
- Launched ZDHC’s Detox Fashion Radar.
- Led and executed document creation for all ZDHC document releases since June 2021:
     * Conducted document design
     * Created visual dashboards
     * Conducted graphic design
- Organised events in in-person, hybrid and online formats:

     * Assisted in organizing events abroad: China, India, Italy, Portugal, Turkey, United States
profile_positions.title: Creative Content Producer & Internal Communications Specialist

profile_positions.description:
- Wrote several successful project proposals and grant applications. 
- Created a video entry for the DCHI x ImpactCity Humanitarian Challenge 2020 that made it to the Top 3 finalists.
- Organized an international online exhibition, "Peace & Dreams: A Child Perspective", to raise awareness about landmine casualties.

profile_positions.title: Grant Writer & Project Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
A non-profit organization catering to Human Rights Activists across the globe by providing them a platform and a voice. I worked in collaboration with WorldTalks and Shelter City Amsterdam whilst under Tertium (Urgent Foundation).

- Led the full production of a research documentary on transnational youth and their rights in the GCC region, titled “‘iinaa bialmanzil -         انا بالمنزل” (I am Home).
- Conducted one-on-one interviews with Human Rights Activists globally.
- Worked on a total of 50 interviews and counting – these include the likes of:
• Political leader Biram Dah Abeid of Mauritania,
• Chief Prosecutor of UN-IRMCT Serge Brammertz of Belgium,
• Founder of Syrian Network for Human Rights (SNHR) Fadel Abdul Ghany of Syria,
• Human rights Activist (specifically working against child marriages) Naha Al-Ahdal of Yemen,
• Women’s and children’s rights Activist Maryam Lee of Malaysia,
• Indigenous people’s rights Activist Artemia Fabre of Mexico, and
• LGBTQ+ rights Activist Akeem Vassel of Jamaica, to name only a few
- Edited the conducted interviews into short documentaries, maintaining their rawness to present the activists and their causes in their most ‘original’ form.
- Trained junior staff.
-Did Web Design for World Talks’ official website (re-launch 2019).

profile_positions.description:
- Immediate assistant to the Chief of Procurement, Maribel Aragones Cacatian
- Archived purchase orders and contracts into the Records Transfer System

- Assisted in performing auditing tasks for October 2019

- Arranged team building retreat/activities

profile_positions.company: United Nations International Residual Mechanism for Criminal Tribunals (IRMCT)
profile_positions.description:
- Produced daily Media Reports by scouring various media outlets to find information relevant to the IRMCT. These media reports were circulated in the Arusha branch and the New York headquarters of the UN
- Wrote news/event updates on Tribunet accessible to all UN staff
- Attended court hearings and status conferences for Ratko Mladic, Jovica Stanišić and Franko Simatović
- Attended to the witnesses coming to court for trial hearings
- Monitored Social Media analytics for social media campaigning on all UN-IRMCT social media platforms: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn, to establish the reach and effectiveness of social media campaigning
- Created promotional media content for social media campaigns (Remember Srebrenica). This included written material, motion graphics, and stills
- Recorded, edited, and produced podcasts in English/BCS for conferences
- Assisted outreach in research by tracking the Bosnian, Serbian, and Croatian diaspora all across Europe
- Assisted in media research and compilation of documents for the use of media organizations
- Assisted the tribunal in conducting research when it launched an investigation into the former Bosnian Serb leader, Radovan Karadzic, for making a phone call to participants at a public forum in Montenegro 
- Compiled all case files of the ICTY and IRMCT into a Media Tool Kit to be used by media outlets to report on the tribunal's workings, past and present
- Did Web Design for an online outreach campaign for the official IRMCT website 
- Hosted several Judges visiting from Brazil
- Hosted colleges, professors, and other visitors visiting the tribunal
- Drafted a speech for the President of IRMCT, Judge Carmel Aguis, delivered on The Hague Open Day of 2019 to the public
- Assisted in event planning and running of events like The Hague Open Day 
- Assisted with crowd control during events
- Curated a weekly and monthly events scheduled for internal circulation
profile_positions.title: External Relations

profile_positions.description:
WildSnapper TV began in the reality TV circuit, working on big format television shows such as The Apprentice Asia, Asia’s Got Talent, Fear Factor Malaysia and The Amazing Race franchises (Asia & USA). It then broadened its scope to include the lifestyle genre branching into observation documentaries like Ocean Witness in conjunction with WWF-Malaysia and Netherlands, and corporate and branded films.

- Worked under the mentorship of Emmy-Award-winning producer, Mrs Zabrina Fernandez
- Created trailers, animated graphics for shows, edited full-length episodes, transcribed scripts, and assisted on set
- Worked on Wildsnapper TV's scripted arm, debuted its first full-length feature “Lahzeye Bi Payan | In An Endless Instant”, written and directed by Bernard Chauly & Zabrina Fernandez
- Projects: Ocean Witness (WWF, NL, MAPA), Cooking For Love (AFC), Stand-Up Asia (Comedy Central), Martin Yan’s Asian Favorites(AFC), Club Mickey Mouse Extra (Disney), and The Gig Guys (Portfolio Entertainment)

volunteer_experiences.description:
The Tittymag is an intersectional feminist art collective. It offers the space for creative talent who is engaged in feminism, inclusivity or empowerment to enter into a dialogue with each other. 

- Contributing articles to the feminist magazine on topics of societal norms among the South-Asian communities, female sexuality, female emancipation, and female empowerment.

(Volunteer-Refugee School, Sunway Mentari)                
Taught refugee children (ages 4 and above) Geography, English and basic Mathematics. Prepared lessons and activities for the children as class-work, home-work and tests.

Fed and cleaned the cages and living areas of all animals. Most animals were rescued from poachers (like the black panthers) or the wild (like the albino lions). Also supervised visitors’ interactions with all animals. I also acted as the focal point of the volunteer group, thus, I was responsible for every volunteer on duty, transport to the volunteer location, the reimbursements, and the attendance roaster.
